catalog_info.title: Experimental Fiction
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Experimentation in modern prose fiction as a challenge to formal conventions, to "content" and to society. Examines the role of the fantastic; play with narrative and perspective; stream-of-consciousness, fragmentation and collage; mixing of genres and modes; hypertextuality, intertextuality and parody; constraints (lipograms), and the intersection of prose, poetry and visual art. Focuses on the works of Kafka, Joyce, Gertrude Stein, Nabokov, Robbe-Grillet, Gombrowicz, Barthelme, Pynchon, Calvino, Pavic, Matthews and Philips.
